scenarios.label: Baseline / Recommended
scenarios.description: Production e-commerce site using App Gateway WAF v2, App Service, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure SQL Database GP 2 vCores with private endpoints, and standard monitoring/backup on PAYG.

resources.notes: Single production VNet with subnets for App Gateway, App Service integration, private endpoints, and management. No direct charge but required for private endpoints and secure topology.

Application Gateway v2 with WAF enabled for internet-facing e-commerce site. Assumes autoscaling with moderate traffic (~50 Mbps average, 2 TB/month egress, 500M HTTP requests). Includes SSL termination and path-based routing to App Service.
Standard public IP for Application Gateway WAF v2. Zone-redundant by default in v2 SKU.

Premium v3 App Service Plan (P1v3) with 2 instances for HA and autoscale headroom. Linux assumed. Includes 250 GB shared SSD storage. Hosts the e-commerce web app and APIs. Integrated with VNet for private endpoint access to SQL and Redis.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v2 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan
Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan

resources.notes: Web App running on the Premium v3 App Service Plan. No separate compute charge beyond the plan; included here for clarity and potential per-app features.
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: Azure Cache for Redis Standard C1 (1 shard, 1 GB cache, HA with replica). Used for session state, output caching, and frequently accessed catalog data. Assumes moderate traffic with up to ~2B operations/month.

Single Azure SQL Database, General Purpose, Gen5, 2 vCores as requested. Assumes 128 GB storage, zone-redundant storage, PITR backups included. Used as primary transactional store for e-commerce (orders, customers, catalog).
resources.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

sku_candidates.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5
SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

resources.notes: Private Endpoint for Azure SQL Database within the VNet. Billed as Private Link endpoint and data processed. Ensures database is not exposed via public endpoint.
Private Endpoint for Azure Cache for Redis to keep cache traffic within the VNet. Billed as Private Link endpoint and data processed.

General-purpose v2 storage account for product images, static content, and logs. Mix of Hot (active images) and Cool (older media). GRS for durability. Includes some internet egress for direct blob access via CDN or app.

resources.notes: Central Log Analytics workspace for App Service, Application Gateway, Azure SQL diagnostics, and platform logs. Assumes ~200 GB/month ingestion with some data moved to archive tier for long-term retention.
Azure Key Vault Standard for connection strings, secrets, and TLS certificates for App Gateway and App Service. Uses managed identities for access.

Recovery Services Vault for backups of App Service content (via Azure Backup or custom scripts) and possibly file-level backups from storage. Azure SQL uses built-in backups but can also be protected for long-term retention. Assumes ~250 GB backup storage.

resources.notes: Placeholder for DR via Azure Site Recovery for any IaaS or critical components if introduced later. Currently minimal usage; can be omitted if DR is explicitly out of scope.
VNet NAT for outbound internet access from App Service integrated subnet and other private resources. Assumes ~500 GB/month outbound traffic for API calls, updates, and third-party integrations.

resources.notes: General internet egress for the solution (App Gateway to clients, App Service outbound calls, blob downloads). Assumes ~3 TB/month total outbound data.

scenarios.label: Cost Optimized
scenarios.description: Lower-cost variant of the e-commerce architecture with smaller App Service plan and Redis, reduced redundancy, but still using App Gateway WAF v2, Azure SQL GP 2 vCores, and private endpoints on PAYG.

resources.notes: Single VNet for production; minimal subnets but still supports private endpoints.
Same WAF v2 SKU but sized for lower traffic (~1 TB/month egress, 200M requests). Autoscale will keep instance count low under light load.
Standard public IP for Application Gateway.
Standard S1 App Service Plan, single instance to reduce cost. Lower SLA and performance than Premium; suitable for smaller traffic or non-peak phases. Can scale out manually if needed.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Standard Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Standard Plan - Linux

resources.notes: Web App hosted on the S1 plan. Single production slot assumed.
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: Azure Cache for Redis Basic C0 (no replica, no SLA) to minimize cost. Suitable for non-critical caching; risk of data loss on node restart.
Azure SQL Database GP Gen5 2 vCores as requested, but with reduced storage (64 GB) to lower cost. Still production-grade with built-in backups.

Private Endpoint for Redis cache in cost-optimized environment.
LRS instead of GRS to reduce cost. Stores product images and static content with smaller footprint.

scenarios.label: High Performance / Scalable
scenarios.description: Scaled-up e-commerce architecture with larger App Service plan, higher-tier Redis, and more storage/throughput, while keeping App Gateway WAF v2 and Azure SQL GP 2 vCores with private endpoints on PAYG.

resources.notes: VNet sized for higher traffic and more subnets; still single region but can be paired with another region for DR.
WAF v2 handling high traffic (~5 TB/month egress, 1.5B requests). Autoscaling to multiple instances under load.
Standard public IP for high-traffic Application Gateway.
Premium v3 P2v3 App Service Plan with 4 instances for high throughput and resilience. Supports autoscale and higher memory/CPU for heavy e-commerce workloads.
resources.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux

sku_candidates.product_name: Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan - Linux
Azure App Service Premium v4 Plan
Azure App Service Premium v3 Plan
Azure App Service Premium Windows Container Plan

resources.notes: Web App hosted on the P2v3 plan, potentially with deployment slots (staging, canary).
resources.product_name: Web App (logical, billed via App Service Plan)

resources.notes: Azure Cache for Redis Premium P1 with persistence, better SLA, and higher throughput. Suitable for heavy session and catalog caching, plus advanced features like clustering if enabled.
Azure SQL Database GP Gen5 2 vCores as requested, but with increased storage and IOPS for higher workload. For extreme performance, consider scaling to 4 vCores, but kept at 2 to respect user choice.
resources.product_name: SQL Database Single/Elastic Pool General Purpose - Compute Gen5

resources.notes: Two Private Endpoints for SQL (e.g., separate subnets or multi-region connectivity) to support high-performance and redundancy scenarios.
Two Private Endpoints for Redis to support multiple subnets or regions and higher throughput.
GZRS for higher durability and availability across zones. Larger capacity for many product images and media assets, with higher egress for CDN or direct downloads.

resources.notes: Higher ingestion volume for detailed diagnostics, application logs, and metrics. Long-term retention via archive.
Premium Key Vault for HSM-backed keys and higher security requirements, including many TLS certificates and secrets.
Larger backup footprint and longer retention for compliance and recovery of app content and configuration. Azure SQL still uses built-in backups but may have long-term retention configured.
